CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ollie Mae Cohen, housewife, 1634 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "No, after 12 o'clock midnight, Saturday the taverns should be closed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ollie Mae Cohen, wearing flecked coat with collar and belt, and light colored head scarf, standing in front of Fannie Farmer Candies, displaying candy boxes
